The strength of an LTE signal is determined by the Reference Signal Received Power (RSRP). The reporting range of RSRP is -140 dBm to -44 dBm. Usable signal is tpyically in a range from -75 dBm (Excellent) to -120 dBm (Unusable)
The strength of a WIFI signal is determined by the Received Siganl Strength Indicator (RSSI). RSSI ranges from -30 dBm (Excellent) to -90 (Unusable).
Graphs are adjusted for bar representation. We added 150 to Cell Signal and 127 to WiFi Signal strength.\nVertical axis indicates signal strength. Horizontal axis indicates time of measurement.

This app is a crowdsourcing project for mapping signal spectrum. 
- Scan for identifying signal strengths around you. 
- Check your signal and phone information in MyInfo. 
- Send signal information to the server for analysis and visualization at Settings. 
- See signal strengths near you at the map on the Home screen.
